quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Sun and Disease
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, astronomer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which transit of planets against the Sun obscures the most of its disk?

options.text: Transit of Jupiter, viewed from Saturn
Transit of Earth, viewed from Mars
Transit of Uranus, viewed from Neptune
Transit of Saturn, viewed from Uranus

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Transit of Jupiter, viewed from Saturn

questions.question: In 1655 the Bubonic Plague hit India and China causing mass casualties.
What kind of Galaxy is the Milky Way?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barred Spiral

questions.question: Which of these most closely describes a Mira Variable?

options.text: A variable that is in the constellation of Mensa
A star that suddenly brightens, dims, then is never as bright again
A red variable with an extreme change in brightness with a short pulsation period
A red star that pulsates once more than 100 days and changes by more than a magnitude

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A red star that pulsates once more than 100 days and changes by more than a magnitude

questions.question: The Spanish Flu took the lives of over 40,000 people between 1918 and 1920.
Which one of these objects does Perseus contain?
Which of these will our Sun eventually become?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Planetary Nebula

questions.question: Which quasar is the brightest as seen from Earth?
What is the most distant object you can see unaided under the best possible conditions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Triangulum Galaxy(M33)

questions.question: Which ancient Greek astronomer cataloged 48 of the constellations?
From what disease did former U.S. President James K. Polk die in 1849?
What is a fast-spinning neutron star that emits pulses of radio waves called?
Ophiuchus is on the ecliptic.
In which constellation did the brightest (Apparent magnitude -9) supernova occur?
In 1952, this disease struck the U.S. and became the worst epidemic in the nations history at that time.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Tobaccos and Death
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, philip, quarts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which is the first US national antismoking coalition, formed in 1964?

options.text: National Interagency Council on Smoking and Health
National Clearinghouse for Smoking and Health

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: National Interagency Council on Smoking and Health

questions.question: How many eggs are in 1 gross?
Which of these cigarette brands is produced by Philip Morris International?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Using the apothecary system, how many grains are in 4 drams?
Which planet has an apparent magnitude of  -2.8 to -1.6?
Which of these smoking devices operates by water-filtration and direct heat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: If a person bought a 5.05 acre tract, how many square feet would be in the 5.05 acre tract?
A woodcutter chopped down enough trees to have 896 cubic feet of firewood. How many cords did he chop?
What caused the death of Wayne McLaren and David McLean, famous for appearing in many Marlboro television and print advertisements?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lung cancer

questions.question: How many fluid ounces do 48 quarts equal?
The World No Tobacco Day, a global event sponsored by the World Health Organization, is held annually on which day?
Approximately how many different chemicals does a smoker inhale with one drag on the cigarette?
This rare, slow burning, strong-tasting tobacco is used as a component of many blended pipe tobaccos, but is too strong to be smoked pure.
This type of tobacco is the mildest of all blending tobaccos and has the highest level of natural dextrose.
This 2003 independent film, directed by Jim Jarmusch, consists of eleven short stories, which focus on coffee and cigarettes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coffee and Cigarettes

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Body and System
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, korotkoff, measuring. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many pecks are in 8 bushels?
In what internal human organ are the islets of Langerhans located?

In order to always have exact change (using U.S. currency) and using the least amount of coins but having at least one of each coin, how many pennies, nickels, dimes and quarters do you have to carry? (The 50 cent piece is excluded).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3 quarters, 1 dime, 2 nickels, 4 pennies

questions.question: In what part of the human body are the Wormian bones, named after Ole Worm, located?
During what medical procedure can the so-called Korotkoff sounds be perceived?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taking blood pressure

questions.question: In what part of the human body is the bundle of His located?
In which unit measuring system do 2,240 pounds equal 1 ton?
The organ of Corti, named after Alfonso Corti, is located in this body part of mammals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inner ear

questions.question: A chain is a unit of measure used primarily in profession?

options.text: A man in control of letting down the anchor on a ship

questions.question: What type of cells are the Purkinje cells, named after Czech anatomist Jan Evangelista Purkyne?
A pharmacist was compounding a mixture for a topical antibiotic. Using the apothecary system, how many pounds did he make if the end product resulted in having twenty-four 3.5 ounce tubes?
The human laryngeal prominence got its common name from this biblical figure.
What type of glands are the Glands of Montgomery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sebaceous glands

questions.question: Clara cells are found in this part of the human body.
The Fallopian tubes are part of this system in the human body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reproductive system

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Water and Tides
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: About 95% of fresh water in the USA is underground. What is the name of the biggest source of fresh water in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ogallala Aquifer

questions.question: It is amazing but true that sometimes hot water can freeze faster than cold water. What is this effect called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mpemba Effect

questions.question: The 2005 movie Water centered on people from this country.
Water sticks to itself. What is this property called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Molecular cohesion

questions.question: It has been proved that drinking only bottled water can have this effect on your health.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Increase in dental problems

questions.question: What is the term for the points in the lunar cycle when the tides range is minimal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neap Tide

questions.question: What is heavy water made of ?

options.text: Two hydrogen atoms and two oxugen atoms
Two deuterium atoms and one oxygen atom
Two oxygen atoms and one hydrogen atom
Three hydrogen atoms and one oxygen molecule.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Two deuterium atoms and one oxygen atom

questions.question: What does the scientific term virga mean?

options.text: The effect on Mars that makes it appear as if water was on Mars
The salt that remains after sea water has been desalinated

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rain that never hits Earth

questions.question: There are high tides and low tides in the bigger water bodies on Earth. Which statement is true about tides?

options.text: Tides are caused by x-rays, not gravity.
Tides are caused by the gravitational effect of the Sun only.
Tides are caused by the gravitational forces of both the Moon and the Sun.
Tides are caused by the gravitational effect of the Moon only.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tides are caused by the gravitational forces of both the Moon and the Sun.

questions.question: Venus is named after the Roman Goddess of what?
Pure water, if it exists, has this pH.
We all know that the formula of water is H2O but can you remember this important property of water: in the water molecule at what angle is each of the hydrogen atoms from the oxygen atom?
On which Chinese river is the 2335 meters (7660 ft) long and 185 meters (616 ft) high Three Gorges Dam located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Yangtze

questions.question: The USA leads” the world in per capita consumption of water. Which country is second?
Control of the Ganges River, sacred to some people, has been much disputed between which two nations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India and Bangladesh

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Venus and Sun
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, zeppelin, greenhouse. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Because of the Greenhouse Effect, Venus has the hottest surface temperature in the Solar System. What is the average temperature on Venus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 460 Degrees C.

questions.question: Paul MacCready designed the first working solar plane. What was its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gossamer Penguin

questions.question: What was the name of the first interplanetary probe to study Venus?
What was the first person to fly a balloon that was filled with hydrogen gas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacques A.C. Charles

questions.question: Venus has no natural satellite or moon.
Venus has the densest atmosphere of the Solar System. What gaseous element comprises the bulk of the atmosphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carbon Dioxide

questions.question: Venus travels around the Sun at an average distance of how many miles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 67 million miles

questions.question: Schiphol Airport is the main airport of this city.
The Planet Venus orbits the Sun once every how many days?
In 1883 Otto Lilienthal became the first person to successfully fly this type of aircraft.
Venus is the third brightest object in the sky after the Sun and what other object?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Moon

questions.question: Which scientist discovered the atmosphere of Venus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mikhail Lomonosov in 1761 A.D

questions.question: What is the difference between a balloon and a zeppelin?

options.text: A balloon can only go up and down; it cannot go East-West or left-right.
A zeppelin has a pilot or pilots below the gas filled chamber.
A zeppelin has a rigid frame around the balloon containing the gases.
A zeppelin is filled with specific gases rather than hot air.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A zeppelin has a rigid frame around the balloon containing the gases.

questions.question: When Charles Lindbergh crossed the Atlantic, he had almost no visibility from his front windows.
What was the first privately financed craft to go into outer space?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Flight and Year
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, actor, magazine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year was the first in-flight meal served?
What is the name of the first in-flight magazine for commercial flights?
Who was the first person to fly solo nonstop around the world in a balloon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Fossett

questions.question: Who was the first US Senator to fly on the Space Shuttle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jake Garn

questions.question: Which of these particles has a negative charge?
What distinction does Dennis Tito hold?

options.text: He was the first tourist in space.
He was the first person to fly the Shuttle, shoot down an enemy  fighter, and fly a balloon across the Atlantic.
He was the first person to fly the Shuttle three times.
He was the first person to make a space walk.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the first tourist in space.

questions.question: Which airlines  introduced  the frequent flyer program?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: American Airlines

questions.question: In 1938 Doug Corrigan set out on a flight from New York to California. What nickname did he get after the flight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wrong Way Corrigan

questions.question: How fast is Mach 1?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1207 kilometers per hour

questions.question: In 1956, Tennessee businessman David Flexer had this great idea.

options.text: Have airlines transport packages on long  flights
Have floatation devices aboard airline flights

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Show movies on airline flights

questions.question: Who was the first actor to attain the rank of Brigadier General in the US Air Force?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Stewart

questions.question: This person is given credit for coining the term surfing the internet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jean Armour  Polly

questions.question: Who helped invent the blender?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Waring

questions.question: In what year did an airplane first hit 200 miles per hour?
What was the name of the first space station?
